PENTHOUSE GROOVE PG Car Air Freshener Celebration DJ Party ğŸ‰!

ğŸ“… Date & Time: Sunday, December 28, 2025 â€“ from 9:00 p.m.
ğŸ“ Venue: NOMATA (JUN Building, 2-17-26 Yakuin, Chuo-ku, Fukuoka)
ğŸ§ DJs: Seiji Shirouzu / TOMMY-G / KAZUNE / YUDAI / GINGALAXY

Officially registered as a utility model by the Japan Patent Office!
PG Car Air Freshener, an item developed by PENTHOUSE GROOVE to dramatically enhance your in-car music experience, has been registered as a utility model with the Japan Patent Office!

To celebrate this, weâ€™re throwing a DJ party at NOMATA in Fukuoka from 9:00 p.m. on December 28, 2025.
Itâ€™s a rare chance to see the item in person and experience it for yourself, so weâ€™d love for you to come through.

Weâ€™ll also be bringing a variety of sounds we recently picked up in Europe!
After our experiences there, weâ€™re ready to welcome you with an even more diverse musical selection.

ğŸŒ For more details, check out our website!
The countdown has already started!

PENTHOUSE GROOVE 2025 Winter Collection!
ã€PENTHOUSE GROOVE so what hoodieã€‘

An original hoodie created to commemorate the PENTHOUSE GROOVE PG Car Air Freshener Celebration DJ Party to be held on 2025/12/28.

Featuring side ribs and a heavy 12 oz fabric for an authentic American casual feel, with an eye-catching four-line print on the front and a design that incorporates the phrase â€œSO WHATâ€ made famous by a certain artist.

In addition, an online-exclusive special version is available on the PENTHOUSE GROOVE website, featuring â€œ45â€ on the pocket, representing the rotation speed of a 7inch record.
If youâ€™re interested, feel free to contact us via DM or email.

Check our website for details â†“
https://penthousegroove.com

ğŸ§ TAKE A BREAK Vol.4 â€“ Voyage de vinyles
In TAKE A BREAK Vol.4, weâ€™re sharing highlights from PENTHOUSE GROOVEâ€™s first Europe trip. That said, calling it a â€œtourâ€ might be a bit of a stretchâ€”this was really my first time traveling in Europe, and I wrote it as a personal memo of the cultures and experiences I encountered along the way.
In the note version, I also talk about the records and shops I came across in Europe.
If you have a moment to take a break, Iâ€™d love for you to give it a read.
